nodes.documentation:
@notice Place a blinded bid with `_blindedBid` =
 keccak256(abi.encodePacked(value, fake, secret)).
 The sent ether is only refunded if the bid is correctly
 revealed in the revealing phase. The bid is valid if the
 ether sent together with the bid is at least "value" and
 "fake" is not true. Setting "fake" to true and sending
 not the exact amount are ways to hide the real bid but
 still make the required deposit. The same address can
 place multiple bids.

bid(bytes32).notice: Place a blinded bid with `_blindedBid` = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(value, fake, secret)). The sent ether is only refunded if the bid is correctly revealed in the revealing phase. The bid is valid if the ether sent together with the bid is at least "value" and "fake" is not true. Setting "fake" to true and sending not the exact amount are ways to hide the real bid but still make the required deposit. The same address can place multiple bids.

reveal(uint256[],bool[],bytes32[]).notice: Reveal your blinded bids. You will get a refund for all correctly blinded invalid bids and for all bids except for the totally highest.

userdoc.notice: A blind auction on a transparent computing platform, during the bidding period a bidder does not actually send their bid, but only a hashed version of it.
